text: Saurashtra, also known as Kathiawar, is a region in the Indian state of Gujarat. This region covers the area of seven districts, including Rajkot, Junagadh, Jamnagar, Porbandar, Bhavnagar, Surendarnagar, and Amreli. It covers an area of 34,338 square kilometers, which is one-third of Gujarat's total land. ==Languages== The most spoken language in the region is Gujarati. ==Population== According to the 1991 census, the total population of the Saurashtra region was noted as 11,190,518 people. ==Occupation== Fishing is a primary occupation among the locals. It is also famous for cattle herding and farming. Along with North Gujarat, the Saurashtra region is also known for its spice production. ==Educational institutes== The Junagadh Agricultural University is an important government educational institute in the Saurashtra region. ==Religious sites== The Somnath temple is an old and historic Hindu temple in the Saurashtra that is dedicated to the Lord Shiva. ==References== Category:Regions of Gujarat
title: Saurashtra
